channel.title: JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [IN-483] Security of data - University Backup System
item.description: Check documentation about University's backup system (HFS) to make sure we can use it while we have some personal data on our servers.
item.summary: Security of data - University Backup System

comments.comment: It looks HFS is suitable to keep also sensitive data. There is an option to encrypt some files/folders and they will be sent by network and kept on backup media in encrypted form.

item.title: [IN-471] Update VLApp form according to Michael feedback
item.description:
I have a quick comments on the layout of the "VL Inclusion details " section:

1. Could you please align the platelets min units and haemoglobin min units on the same row with minimum platelets and haemoglobin respectively...similar to how Age min and Age max data is captured in the inclusion exclusion riteria...

2. The details in the "VL inclusion details " section are part of the inclusion/Exclusion criteria, it will be better if you ad them in the section of inclusion/exclusion criteria.
item.summary: Update VLApp form according to Michael feedback

item.title: [IN-440] Aileen request for help with a map for TRAC II map team
item.description:
I have been asked by the TRAC team in MORU (Mehul is heavily involved in this project) about developing a simple map image of their sites which will then go on our website as we host the information on the TRAC project - something similar to what you did for the EQA map. 

I know you guys are all very busy, but would this be something you'd be able to do? I'm happy to try to do this if you think it's pretty straight forward and it doesn't require any coding. If you don't have time to do this, then would you be happy to spare 5/10 mins to show me what tool you use and a v quick demonstration?
item.summary: Aileen request for help with a map for TRAC II map team

item.title: [IN-439] Scope unify database with Patricia at USP
item.description:
Very high level scoping of what it would take to develop a specific DB on individual sampling data

For USP database, I think we should do a very high level scoping of what it would take to develop a specific DB on individual sampling data, in order to budget and discuss with USP a possible funding. At this stage I would not like to invest more than half a day of work on that until we have a good confidence of funding and willingness form USP to pursue this project

I suggest that we do our home work first on scoping the USP database and yours and trying to find out what it would take, we need to be clear on the questions we have to them. 

Medicines Quality Database (MQDB)
http://www.usp.org/global-health-programs/promoting-quality-medicines-pqmusaid/medicines-quality-database-mqdb
item.summary: Scope unify database with Patricia at USP

item.title: [IN-391] Install Ansible
item.description: Install and try to use Ansible to start central management of WWARN servers

comments.comment: Installation itself is very simple. I have problems with good usage in our case. Now it is used to distribute firewall script across servers and is working fine. We can think of new usage ideas.

item.title: [IN-390] Make tests of application using R & TeX on new app server
item.description: I'd like to deploy PCE on app-live server to check how it works with freshly installed libraries.
item.summary: Make tests of application using R & TeX on new app server

comments.comment: I have managed to extract packages, R libraries, TeX and fonts needed to sucessfully run PCE on new application server. I'll create article in Drupal about it.

item.title: [IN-20] Non-malarial febrile illness Surveyor
item.description: Non-malarial febrile illness (NMFI) disease maps present published health literature for causes of NMFI. These maps explore the geographical distribution of key pathogens identified as causing fever-driven illness other than malaria. They help to guide the development of improved algorithms for syndromic management of fever, prioritise diagnostic development, and potentially guide empirical therapy.

item.title: [IN-16] Molecular surveyor
item.description: The Molecular Surveyor is an interactive mapping tool that provides researchers and policy makers with an overview of the changes in the prevalence of molecular markers associated with malaria drug resistance over time and location. It helps to inform international, regional and national surveillance strategies.

item.title: [IN-15] Antimalarial Quality Surveyor
item.description: Antimalarial Quality Surveyor: visualises summaries of published reports of antimalarial medicine quality, displaying their geographical distribution across regions and over time. This tool is available in both French and English and provides country summaries.

item.title: [IN-14] K13 Molecular Surveyor
item.description: The K13 Molecular Surveyor is an interactive map that summarises the prevalence of these molecular markers in the propeller region of the Kelch 13 gene of the malaria parasite by location and year, providing a clear and standardised visualisation of the evidence to date to inform key international, regional and national monitoring strategies.

item.title: [IN-13] Schistosomiasis data platform
item.description:
We provide the Schistosomiasis community with a reliable and standardised data collection platform to facilitate data sharing, pooled data analyses, and application of these findings to provide evidence for policy makers and drug developers to optimise the therapeutic life of existing and new Schistosomiasis dugs

From an informatics point of view this project will contain the following stories:

  • An easy to use tool for schisto researches which will allow them to upload and edit data (schsitoExpress)
  • A complex tool for wwarn curators which will facilitate the cleaning and standarization of the data. (SchistoApp)
  • A visualization tool which will show a summary of all the data collected. (SchistoSurveyor)

item.title: [IN-12] Study Group Data Management
item.description:
This project aims to integrate different study group data from different clinical researches.

The main goals of this project are:

  • Create a single point of access to study group data
  • Standardized all the study group data
  • Facilitate the access to the study group information
  • Track feedback from all the contacts involved in a study group
